data.name: Surskit
data.flavorText: It secretes a thick, sweet-scented syrup from the tip of its head. It lives on weed-choked ponds.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Masquerain
data.flavorText: The antennae have distinctive patterns that look like eyes. When it rains, they grow heavy, making flight impossible.

attacks.name: Daunting Eyes
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, shuffle an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their deck.

data.name: Pansage
data.flavorText: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Simisage
data.flavorText: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

abilities.name: Monkey Trio
abilities.text: If you have Simisage, Simisear, and Simipour in play, ignore all Colorless Energy in the costs of attacks used by this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Arm Thrust Needle
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon that have an Ability, except any Simisage.

data.name: Froslass ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Evanescent
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out, flip a coin. If heads, your opponent takes 1 fewer Prize card.

attacks.name: Frost Bullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dwebble
data.flavorText: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

data.name: Crustle
data.flavorText: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They're mighty enough to crack Rhyperior's carapace.

attacks.name: Crag Bash
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks from Evolution Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Bounsweet
data.flavorText: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled- down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Blipbug
data.flavorText: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Steenee
data.flavorText: Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Nymble
data.flavorText: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

data.name: Dottler
data.flavorText: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

attacks.name: Protect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Crocalor
data.flavorText: The combination of Crocalor's fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon's head.

attacks.name: Rolling Fireball
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Charcadet
data.flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

attacks.name: Fiery Fighting Spirit
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Armarouge ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Crimson Armor
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP, it takes 80 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Scorching Bazooka
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Feebas
data.flavorText: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.

attacks.name: Drawup Power
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Orbeetle
data.flavorText: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what's around it—and what's around it can include things over six miles away.

attacks.name: Satellite Beam
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy card in your opponent's discard pile.

attacks.name: Brain Shake
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Nymble
data.flavorText: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

data.name: Toedscruel
data.flavorText: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

abilities.name: Slime Mold Colony
abilities.text: Cards in your opponent's discard pile can't be put into their hand by an effect of your opponent's Abilities or Trainer cards.

attacks.name: Mushroom Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Simisear
data.flavorText: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

abilities.name: Monkey Trio
abilities.text: If you have Simisage, Simisear, and Simipour in play, ignore all Colorless Energy in the costs of attacks used by this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Volcanion
data.flavorText: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

attacks.name: Dual Turbo
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon and attach a Basic Fire Energy card from your discard pile to each of them.

data.name: Seadra
data.flavorText: Seadra's mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that's larger than the opening of its mouth.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Kingdra
data.flavorText: Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a splendorous gleam to them that they've been given to royalty as gifts.

attacks.name: Whirltide
attacks.text: Reveal the top 6 cards of your deck. This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each Energy card you find there. Then, discard those Energy cards and shuffle the other cards back into your deck. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Toedscool
data.flavorText: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Charcadet
data.flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

attacks.name: Protect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Iron Moth
data.flavorText: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon's traits match up with an object described in an old book.

abilities.name: Thermal Reactor
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may move any amount of Fire Energy from your other Pokémon to it.

attacks.name: Heat Ray
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Heat Ray.

data.name: Horsea
data.flavorText: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

data.name: Remoraid
data.flavorText: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine's underside to scavenge for leftovers.

data.name: Toedscool
data.flavorText: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.

attacks.name: Clinging Spore
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Wo-Chien
data.flavorText: It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.

attacks.name: Leaf Bringer
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Grass Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Binding Greed
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon cost ColorlessColorless more.

data.name: Magby
data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day's fatigue.

attacks.name: Scorching Heater
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Fuecoco
data.flavorText: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

data.name: Chi-Yu
data.flavorText: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.

attacks.name: Flare Bringer
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Megafire of Envy
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Octillery
data.flavorText: It traps enemies with its suction-cupped tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

abilities.name: Suction Cup Draw
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Smokescreen Shot
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Milotic
data.flavorText: It's said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you're feeling.

abilities.name: Lifeboat
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. Each player puts a Basic Pokémon from their discard pile onto their Bench. (Your opponent puts a Basic Pokémon onto their Bench first.)

attacks.name: Hypno Splash
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Garchomp ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Lander
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Basic Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Sonic Dive
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mantyke
data.flavorText: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they'll all fight together to repel attackers.

attacks.name: Buoyant Healing
attacks.text: Heal 120 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Chien-Pao
data.flavorText: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokémon.

attacks.name: Snow Bringer
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wrathful Blade
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Plusle
data.flavorText: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.

attacks.name: Plus Damage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Galvantula
data.flavorText: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.

attacks.name: Electrobullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Oricorio
data.flavorText: The energetic, cheerful dance of these Oricorio is popular with children, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.

attacks.name: Pep Up
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Volt Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Tapu Koko ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Vengeful Shock
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 90 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Extreme Current
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Iron Hands ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Amp You Very Much
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

data.name: Latios
data.flavorText: It understands human speech and is highly intelligent. It is a tender Pokémon that dislikes fighting.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Simipour
data.flavorText: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

abilities.name: Monkey Trio
abilities.text: If you have Simisage, Simisear, and Simipour in play, ignore all Colorless Energy in the costs of attacks used by this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Liquid Lashing
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Vanillish
data.flavorText: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it's a kind Pokémon.

data.name: Wimpod
data.flavorText: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy's presence.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Veluza
data.flavorText: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.

abilities.name: Fillet Memento
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, move up to 2 Water Energy cards from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Iron Bundle
data.flavorText: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Hyper Blower
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.) If you do, discard this Pokémon and all attached cards.

attacks.name: Refrigerated Stream
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Palkia
data.flavorText: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Vanilluxe
data.flavorText: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.

abilities.name: Frigid Room
abilities.text: Your opponent's Pokémon that have 40 HP or less remaining can't attack.

data.name: Wimpod
data.flavorText: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy's presence.

attacks.name: Sneaky Snacking
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Wiglett
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

attacks.name: Fury Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Wiglett
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

data.name: Elekid
data.flavorText: It's not good at storing electricity yet. This Pokémon sneaks into people's homes, looking for electrical outlets to eat electricity from.

attacks.name: Crackling Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Minun
data.flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

abilities.name: Buddy Pulse
abilities.text: If you have Plusle in play, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. The effect of Buddy Pulse doesn't stack.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

attacks.name: Burst of Braying
attacks.text: Choose Basic Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile up to the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They're often found sticking to Yamper's hindquarters.

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Zekrom
data.flavorText: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

attacks.name: Crushing Short
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: This attack also does 40 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Toxel
data.flavorText: This selfish, attention-seeking Pokémon stores poison and electricity in two different sacs inside its body.

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Xatu
data.flavorText: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.

abilities.name: Clairvoyant Sense
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Basic Psychic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, draw 2 cards.

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.

attacks.name: Ice Shard
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Vanillite
data.flavorText: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.

data.name: Tsareena ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Icicle Sole
attacks.text: Put damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon until its remaining HP is 30.

attacks.name: Trop Kick
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon, and it recovers from all Special Conditions.

data.name: Golisopod
data.flavorText: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner's meal.

attacks.name: Powerful Cross
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

data.name: Golisopod ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swing and Skedaddle
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Wugtrio
data.flavorText: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

abilities.name: Suddenly Select
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon Tool cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Triple Whip
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

data.name: Dondozo
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.

attacks.name: Supplemental Swallow-Up
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. You may attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to this Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Mewtwo ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Transfer Charge
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Psychic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Photon Kinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Natu
data.flavorText: Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.

attacks.name: Triple Strike
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Yamask
data.flavorText: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Pumpkaboo
data.flavorText: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Tinkatuff
data.flavorText: These Pokémon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each other's hammers by smashing them together.

attacks.name: Alloy Aswing
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Metal Energy attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Tinkaton
data.flavorText: The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.

attacks.name: Crushing Blow
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Alloyed Hammer
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Metal Energy attached, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Deoxys
data.flavorText: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

attacks.name: Genome Spiral
attacks.text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Cofagrigus ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Gold Coffin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Hollow Hands
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Gourgeist
data.flavorText: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.

abilities.name: Startling Pumpkin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, discard 2 random cards from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Flittle
data.flavorText: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.

attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Tinkatink
data.flavorText: This Pokémon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it's satisfied with the result.

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Espathra
data.flavorText: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.

abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may prevent all damage from and effects of attacks from your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Glittering Eyes

data.flavorText: This Pokémon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until it's satisfied with the result.

attacks.name: Mountain Scrounging
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your deck. You may put that card into your hand. If you don't, discard that card and draw a card.

data.name: Scream Tail
data.flavorText: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.

attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each damage counter on this Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Minior
data.flavorText: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.

abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, when you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gravitational Tackle

You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Technical Machine: Evolution

attacks.name: Evolution
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Medical Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.  When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, heal 30 damage from that Pokémon.

data.name: Crustle
data.flavorText: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They're mighty enough to crack Rhyperior's carapace.

attacks.name: Crag Bash
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks from Evolution Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Dottler
data.flavorText: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

attacks.name: Protect

data.name: Techno Radar
rules: You can use this card only if you discard another card from your hand.    Search your deck for up to 2 Future Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Magby
data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day's fatigue.

data.name: Vanillish

data.name: Toedscruel
data.flavorText: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.

attacks.name: Mushroom Drain

data.name: Iron Moth
data.flavorText: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon's traits match up with an object described in an old book.

data.name: Tulip
rules: Put up to 4 in any combination of Psychic Pokémon and Basic Psychic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Garchomp ex
rules: Tera: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Lander
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Basic Fighting Energy cards from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Sonic Dive
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Altaria ex
rules: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Humming Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Light Pulse
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

data.name: Mela
rules: You can use this card only if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.    Attach a Basic Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Parasol Lady
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If you go second and it's your first turn, draw 8 cards instead.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Counter Catcher
rules: You can use this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.  Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Reversal Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.    If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, and if this card is attached to an Evolution Pokémon that doesn't have a Rule Box (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes), this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 3 Energy at a time.
